title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: Led by Alexander earl of Buchan, great constable of France, they performed good service in that great battle at Banje-en-Anjou, where the English were completely routed ; and at Yerneuil, where Buchan died sword in hand, like a brave knight, and covered with renown, at the same moment that Swinton, the gallant laird of Dalswinton, slew the boasting Clarence with one thrust of his border-spear.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns :

snippet: After all, however, Burns had one object of worldly business  in his journey ; namely, to examine the farms on the estate of Dalswinton, near Dumfries, the proprietor of which had, on learning that the poet designed to return to his original calling, expressed a strong wish to have him for his tenant.

snippet: That Mr. Miller was anxious to serve Burns, seems to have been generally  known in Edinburgh ; for in Dr. Blair's letter, dated on 4th May, 1787, in answer to a note written by Burns on the previous day, intimating that he was about to leave town, the Doctor supposes that he is "going down to Dalswinton to look at some of Mr. Miller's farms."
